com.vaadin.addon.timeline
Class Timeline

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
      com.vaadin.addon.timeline.Timeline
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.terminal.Paintable, com.vaadin.terminal.Sizeable, com.vaadin.terminal.VariableOwner, com.vaadin.ui.Component, Serializable, EventListener
public class Timeline
extends com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent

Vaadin Timeline implementation.

Since:
1.0
Author:
John Ahlroos / Vaadin Ltd 2010-2012

 boolean isClientCacheEnabled()
          Is the client cache enabled
Client cache is used to store the data on the client side so less data is sent over the network.
 boolean isDateSelectEnabled()
          Is the date select enabled.
The date select is the text fields in the top right corner of the component which shows the currently selected date range.
The date range can be used to either just display the currently selected date range or one can allow the used to manually edit the selected date range by clicking on the dates by setting enabled to true.

addGraphDataSource

@Deprecated
public void addGraphDataSource(com.vaadin.data.Container.Indexed dataSource)
Deprecated. Use #addGraphDataSource(Indexed, Object, Object) instead

Adds a graph data source.

The graph data source should use the default property id:s PropertyId.TIMESTAMP and PropertyId.VALUE or the property id:s should immediately be set with setGraphTimestampPropertyId() and setGraphValuePropertyId().

Note: The graph has to be sorted by the timestamp value for the timeline to work properly!

Parameters:
dataSource - The data source container

addGraphDataSource

public void addGraphDataSource(com.vaadin.data.Container.Indexed dataSource,
                               Object timestampPropertyId,
                               Object valuePropertyId)

Adds a new graph data source.

Note: The graph has to be sorted by the timestamp value for the timeline to work properly!

Parameters:
dataSource - The data source
timestampPropertyId - The timestamp property id
valuePropertyId - The value property id

removeGraphDataSource

protected void removeGraphDataSource(int graphIndex)
Remove graph data source.
This will remove the graph data source and all properties related to it from the Timeline.

Parameters:
graphIndex - The index of the graph data source

removeGraphDataSource

dataSource - The graphs data source

setMarkerDataSource

@Deprecated
public void setMarkerDataSource(com.vaadin.data.Container.Indexed markers)
Deprecated. Use #setMarkerDataSource(Indexed, Object, Object, Object) instead

Set the marker event data source.
The marker event data source needs to have three specific properties; a timestamp property, a caption property and a value property. These will be used to draw the markers on to the timeline. This method will use the default property id:s to search for these properties.

Parameters:
markers - The markers data source

setMarkerDataSource

                                Object captionPropertyId,
                                Object valuePropertyId)

Parameters:
markers - A container with the markers

setClientCacheEnabled

public void setClientCacheEnabled(boolean enabled)
Sets the state of the client cache.
Client cache is used to store the data on the client side so less data is sent over the network. If the client cache is disabled then all data is always read from the data source and transferred over the network to the client. The preferred option is to leave this on.

Parameters:
enabled - If true then turns client cache on

isClientCacheEnabled

public boolean isClientCacheEnabled()
Is the client cache enabled
Client cache is used to store the data on the client side so less data is sent over the network. If the client cache is disabled then all data is always read from the data source and transferred over the network to the client. The preferred option is to leave this on.

public void removeAllGraphDataSources()
Removes all graph data sources from the Timeline.
NOTE: This however will not clear the marker and event data sources!

setDateSelectEnabled

public void setDateSelectEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enable manual editing of selected date range.
The date select is the text fields in the top right corner of the component which shows the currently selected date range.
The date range can be used to either just display the currently selected date range or one can allow the used to manually edit the selected date range by clicking on the dates by setting enabled to true.

Parameters:
enabled - Is the date selected manually editable

isDateSelectEnabled

public boolean isDateSelectEnabled()
Is the date select enabled.
The date select is the text fields in the top right corner of the component which shows the currently selected date range.
The date range can be used to either just display the currently selected date range or one can allow the used to manually edit the selected date range by clicking on the dates by setting enabled to true.

addZoomLevel

public void addZoomLevel(String caption,
                         Long time)
Add a zoom level.
Adds a custom zoom level. Zoom levels are defined as milliseconds and are added to the top left of the Timeline component.

Parameters:
caption - The title of the zoom level
time - The timespan of the zoom level

public void removeZoomLevel(String caption)

Zoom levels are defined as milliseconds and are added to the top left of the Timeline component.

Setting the color to NULL will remove the grid.

Parameters:

getGraphGridColor

public Color getGraphGridColor()
Gets the grid color used to draw the vertical and horizontal scale grids.
Returns null if no grid is drawn in the graph

Returns:
The color of the graph

setBrowserSelectionLock

public void setBrowserSelectionLock(boolean locked)
When using dynamically updating graphs the updates may cause the selection bar to move when new items are added to the data source and the graph changes. To lock the browser bar so it stays still and instead the selection changes when new items are added set this to false. By default the selection bar is locked to the selection.
Please note that when the selection lock is unlocked then the selection range will change with each update.

Parameters:
locked - Should the selection range be locked to the selected range or should the selection change when new items are added to the data source

stacked - Should the graphs be stacked

setVerticalGridLines

public void setVerticalGridLines(float... values)
Sets at what distances the vertical grid lines should be drawn. Set empty list to remove grid lines or NULL to automatically calculate the grid lines using the formula max/5*(1 to 4).

Parameters:
values - The values where the grid lines should be drawn

setGraphBufferSize

public void setGraphBufferSize(int amountOfPoints)
To gain smoother transitions when browsing the graph and less HTTP requests some points are rendered off-screen so they are available when the graph time range is changed.

Parameters:
amountOfPoints - The amount of off-screen points to add before and after the actual rendering. By default 100 points are used.

setUniformBarThicknessEnabled

public void setUniformBarThicknessEnabled(boolean enabled)
When displaying non-uniform data as a bar chart the bar widths will vary depending on the data distribution. To make the bars equal size set this to true. By default uniform bar thickness is disabled.

Parameters:
enabled - When turned on the bars in the bar chart all have the same thickness

isUniformBarThicknessEnabled

public boolean isUniformBarThicknessEnabled()
When displaying non-uniform data as a bar chart the bar widths will vary depending on the data distribution. To make the bars equal size set this to true. By default uniform bar thickness is disabled.

Returns:

setDuplicateHandler

public void setDuplicateHandler(Timeline.DuplicateHandler handler)
When displaying data where duplicates points are defined for the same date-time then a duplicate handler is called to resolve the value for that date. The duplicate handler should return the value which should be displayed in the graph. Returning null will remove the point altogether from the graph. By default no duplicate handler is present.

Parameters:
handler - THe handler to handle duplicate points

getDuplicateHandler

public Timeline.DuplicateHandler getDuplicateHandler()
When displaying data where duplicates points are defined for the same date-time then a duplicate handler is called to resolve the value for that date. The duplicate handler should return the value which should be displayed in the graph. Returning null will remove the point altogether from the graph. By default no duplicate handler is present.
